meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a column.
meanings.sent1: The columnar building stood tall and straight.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf had a columnar design with vertical lines.
meanings.sent3: The columnar trees looked like soldiers standing in a row.
meanings.sent4: Her columnar posture made her seem regal and dignified.
meanings.sent5: The columnar architecture of the museum was impressive and grand.

meanings.sent1: The columnar rows of corn stretched across the field.
meanings.sent2: The data in the spreadsheet was displayed in a columnar format.
meanings.sent3: The columnar arrangement of chairs made the room feel organized.
meanings.sent4: The columnar structure of the bookshelves maximized space efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The columnar layout of the city streets made navigation easy.

meanings.sent1: The columnar crystals sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The rock formation had a columnar shape that fascinated geologists.
meanings.sent3: The columnar arrangement of cupcakes at the party was visually appealing.
meanings.sent4: The columnar pattern of the wallpaper added a modern touch to the room.
meanings.sent5: The columnar structure of the beehive provided efficient storage for honey.
